  "title": "Admin & Logistics Officer",
  "description": "WTS Energy -&nbsp;Our client is a leading international energy and infrastructure conglomerate sourcing for suitable candidates for its subsidiary.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Admin &amp; Logistics Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Port Harcourt, RIvers

Job Summary


	The Rig Admin Officer provides comprehensive administrative, personnel, and logistics coordination support at the rig site to ensure efficient day-to-day operations.
	The role supports rig management by managing crew documentation, reporting, logistics coordination, and compliance with company policies, regulatory requirements, and HSE standards in a field environment.


Key Responsibilties
Rig Administration &amp; Documentation:


	Manage all administrative activities on the rig site in line with company policies and procedures.
	Maintain accurate records of rig personnel, attendance, crew rotation schedules, and movement logs.
	Prepare and submit daily, weekly, and monthly administrative and manpower reports to head office.
	Maintain proper filing, control, and safekeeping of rig administrative records, permits, and correspondence.


Personnel &amp; Crew Management Support:


	Coordinate crew onboarding, mobilization, demobilization, and rotation schedules.
	Verify personnel documentation including IDs, medicals, certifications, permits, and approvals.
	Maintain updated crew lists, headcount records, and accommodation allocations.
	Support welfare administration and personnel-related documentation as required.


Logistics &amp; Camp Coordination:


	Coordinate logistics for personnel movement, including transport schedules, manifests, and site access approvals.
	Liaise with logistics teams on delivery of consumables, PPE, food supplies, and administrative materials.
	Support camp administration, accommodation planning, and basic welfare services on site.
	Monitor inventory of administrative and camp-related items and initiate requisitions when required.


HSE &amp; Regulatory Compliance Support:


	Support compliance with company HSE policies and rig site rules from an administrative perspective.
	Maintain HSE-related administrative records such as training attendance, inductions, and toolbox meeting registers.
	Provide documentation support during audits, inspections, and regulatory visits.
	Escalate administrative non-compliance issues or risks to rig management promptly.


Communication &amp; Coordination:


	Serve as the administrative liaison between the rig site and head office functions (HR, Logistics, HSE, Finance).
	Support coordination between rig management and support teams to ensure timely information flow.
	Manage official site correspondence and reporting in a professional and timely manner.


Professional Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree or HND in Business Administration, Logistics, Supply Chain, Public Administration, or a related discipline.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in an Admin, Logistics, or Office Support role, preferably within an oilfield services, rig, or industrial company.
	Certification in Logistics, Office Administration, or Customer Service is an added advantage.
	Prior experience in a structured, compliance driven environment is desirable.


The ideal candidate should have:


	Worked as rig administrators, coordinated crew change, handled accommodation and logistics, or Carried out administrative roles within the hospitality sector.


Knowledge and Skills Required:


	Strong knowledge of office administration and logistics coordination practices.
	Good understanding of personnel movement and logistics in oil &amp; gas or industrial environments.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word,Excel, Outlook).
	Strong communication, interpersonal, and coordination skills.
	Excellent organizational, multitasking, and time management abilities.
	High level of professionalism, discretion, and attention to detail.

Admin & Logistics Officer Job at WTS Energy




        
    

        
        WTS Energy - Our client is a leading international energy and infrastructure conglomerate sourcing for suitable candidates for its subsidiary.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Admin & Logistics Officer

Job Location: Port Harcourt, RIvers

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Rig Admin Officer provides comprehensive administrative, personnel, and logistics coordination support at the rig site to ensure efficient day-to-day operations.
	The role supports rig management by managing crew documentation, reporting, logistics coordination, and compliance with company policies, regulatory requirements, and HSE standards in a field environment.


Key Responsibilties
Rig Administration & Documentation:


	Manage all administrative activities on the rig site in line with company policies and procedures.
	Maintain accurate records of rig personnel, attendance, crew rotation schedules, and movement logs.
	Prepare and submit daily, weekly, and monthly administrative and manpower reports to head office.
	Maintain proper filing, control, and safekeeping of rig administrative records, permits, and correspondence.


Personnel & Crew Management Support:


	Coordinate crew onboarding, mobilization, demobilization, and rotation schedules.
	Verify personnel documentation including IDs, medicals, certifications, permits, and approvals.
	Maintain updated crew lists, headcount records, and accommodation allocations.
	Support welfare administration and personnel-related documentation as required.


Logistics & Camp Coordination:


	Coordinate logistics for personnel movement, including transport schedules, manifests, and site access approvals.
	Liaise with logistics teams on delivery of consumables, PPE, food supplies, and administrative materials.
	Support camp administration, accommodation planning, and basic welfare services on site.
	Monitor inventory of administrative and camp-related items and initiate requisitions when required.


HSE & Regulatory Compliance Support:


	Support compliance with company HSE policies and rig site rules from an administrative perspective.
	Maintain HSE-related administrative records such as training attendance, inductions, and toolbox meeting registers.
	Provide documentation support during audits, inspections, and regulatory visits.
	Escalate administrative non-compliance issues or risks to rig management promptly.


Communication & Coordination:


	Serve as the administrative liaison between the rig site and head office functions (HR, Logistics, HSE, Finance).
	Support coordination between rig management and support teams to ensure timely information flow.
	Manage official site correspondence and reporting in a professional and timely manner.


Professional Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree or HND in Business Administration, Logistics, Supply Chain, Public Administration, or a related discipline.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in an Admin, Logistics, or Office Support role, preferably within an oilfield services, rig, or industrial company.
	Certification in Logistics, Office Administration, or Customer Service is an added advantage.
	Prior experience in a structured, compliance driven environment is desirable.


The ideal candidate should have:


	Worked as rig administrators, coordinated crew change, handled accommodation and logistics, or Carried out administrative roles within the hospitality sector.


Knowledge and Skills Required:


	Strong knowledge of office administration and logistics coordination practices.
	Good understanding of personnel movement and logistics in oil & gas or industrial environments.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word,Excel, Outlook).
	Strong communication, interpersonal, and coordination skills.
	Excellent organizational, multitasking, and time management abilities.
	High level of professionalism, discretion, and attention to detail.

title: Job Vacancies at Ecobank Nigeria Plc
content:
Ecobank Transnational Incorporated (ETI), a public limited liability company, was established as a bank holding company in 1985 under a private sector initiative spearheaded by the Federation of West African Chambers of Commerce and Industry with the support of the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS).

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer

Job Identification: 1211
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Job Schedule: Full time

Key Responsibilities 
Testing & Quality Assurance:
     

            
    




	Review requirements and technical designs to identify test scenarios early.
	Perform manual and automated testing on backend services, APIs, and integrations.
	Validate system performance, reliability, and data accuracy across environments.
	Identify, document, and track defects through to resolution.


Automation & Process Improvement:


	Develop and maintain automated test scripts for regression and integration testing.
	Support CI/CD pipelines by integrating automated tests into deployment workflows.
	Continuously improve test coverage and testing practices


Collaboration & Compliance:


	Work closely with software engineers and business analysts to ensure issues are clearly understood and resolved.
	Ensure testing aligns with security, compliance, and regulatory requirements common in banking systems.


Experience & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
	3+ years of experience in software testing or quality assurance.


Required Skills and Tools:
Testing Tools & Techniques:


	Manual and automated testing methodologies
	API testing tools (Postman, Swagger, or similar)
	Test case design, execution, and reporting.


Automation & Scripting:


	Basic scripting knowledge (Python, JavaScript, or similar)
	Familiarity with test automation frameworks (e.g., Selenium, Playwright, or equivalent).


Systems & Platforms:


	Understanding of REST APIs and backend services
	Basic knowledge of databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, or MongoDB)
	Exposure to CI/CD tools such as GitHub Actions


Quality & Compliance:


	Attention to detail and strong defect-tracking skills
	Awareness of security and compliance requirements in financial systems


Soft Skills:


	Strong analytical and critical-thinking skills
	Clear communication and documentation ability
	Collaborative mindset and attention to detail


Application Closing Date: 2nd February, 2026, 04:57 PM.

Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Backend Engineer

Job Identification: 1209
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos

Key Responsibilities
Software Development & Delivery:


	Design and develop backend services and APIs using modern frameworks and best practices.
	Build and maintain microservices that integrate with core banking systems and third-party platforms.
	Ensure applications are secure, performant, and compliant with banking technology standards.
	Write clean, maintainable code and participate in code reviews to improve overall quality.


System Integration & Architecture:


	Develop REST APIs, WebSocket services, and GRPC interfaces for internal and external integrations.
	Implement event-driven solutions to support asynchronous processing and system scalability.
	Work with cloud services to deploy and manage applications in production environments.


Collaboration & Continuous Improvement:


	Work closely with QA engineers, business analysts, and product teams to clarify requirements and resolve issues early.
	Support CI/CD pipelines and improve development workflows where possible.
	Participate in technical discussions and contribute ideas that improve system reliability and efficiency.


Experience & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field
	3-4; years of professional software development experience, preferably in fintech or banking technology.


Required Skills and Tools:
Programming & Frameworks:


	Python (FASTAPI, Flask, Django)
	Java (Spring Boot)
	Node.js


Databases:


	PostgreSQL, MySQL
	MongoDB, DynamoDB


Event-Driven & Integration Technologies:


	RabbitMQ
	REST APIs, WebSocket, gRPC


Cloud & DevOps Tools:


	AWS
	Docker
	GitHub Actions
	Serverless Framework


Engineering Practices:


	Microservices architecture
	CI/CD pipelines
	Secure coding and familiarity with SOC compliance standards


Soft Skills:


	Strong problem-solving and analytical thinking
	Clear communication and teamwork
	Ability to work in structured, regulated environments.


Application Closing Date: 2nd February, 2026, 03:19 PM.

Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Manager, Network Security

Job Identification: 1200
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Job Schedule: Full time

Job Purpose


	The Manager, Network Security is responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining robust network security frameworks to protect the organization’s IT infrastructure from cyber threats.
	This role ensures the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of network systems by developing security policies, managing firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems, and conducting vulnerability assessments.
	The incumbent will lead a team of security professionals, oversee incident response efforts, and collaborate with IT and business units to enhance cybersecurity resilience.
	Additionally, the role involves staying updated on emerging security threats and technologies to proactively mitigate risks and ensure compliance with regulatory and industry standards.
	Ensure compliance with regulatory and industry security standards, such as ISO 27001, NIST, and PCI-DSS.
	Manage security-related projects, including the deployment of advanced security solutions and infrastructure upgrades.
	Report on network security status, risks, and improvement plans to senior management and stakeholders.
	Monitor emerging security threats, trends, and technologies to proactively implement protective measures.


Job Context


	Project Management: Plan and execute projects related to network and security, including migrations, upgrades, and new deployments. Ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget, and meet defined success criteria. Document project processes, technical designs, and post-implementation reviews.
	Strategic Leadership: Develop and execute strategies for efficient network and security management, ensuring alignment with organizational objectives. Lead the evaluation and adoption of new technologies to enhance the security posture of the Bank.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and implement policies, standards, and procedures for application delivery. Sourcing and implementing new security solutions to better protect the organization
	Technical Management: Ensure the bank meets the requirements of PCI and other Security standards with respect to Firewall Management. Manage the firewall deployment, rules migrations, and firewall administration. Conducting proactive research to analyse security weaknesses and recommend appropriate strategies
	Performance Optimization: Inspect inbound and outbound security traffic patterns. Identify anomalies and potential threats. Optimize firewall rules to reduce latency. Use deep packet inspection (DPI) and behavioural analytics to monitor security traffic.
	Collaboration with Stakeholders: Lead and mentor a team of network and security specialists, fostering growth and development. Coordinate with vendors and service providers to ensure timely support, licensing renewals, and resolution of technical issues. Manage contracts, budgets, and procurement related to security infrastructure.
	Security Implementation: Implement and maintain security measures to protect the Bank’s network from threats and vulnerabilities. Ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations, including data protection and cybersecurity requirements. Conduct regular audits and reviews to identify risks and recommend mitigations.
	Capacity Planning: Conduct capacity planning assessments to ensure firewall can handle current and future application.


Key Responsibilities
The Manager, Network Application Delivery will develop: 


	Network Security Strategy & Implementation
	Develop, implement, and enforce network security policies, standards, and best practices.
	Design and maintain secure network architectures, including firewalls, VPNs, IDS/IPS, and endpoint security solutions.
	Evaluate and implement emerging security technologies to enhance network security posture.


Threat Management & Incident Response:


	Monitor and analyse security alerts to identify and mitigate threats in real time.
	Lead incident response efforts, ensuring timely containment, investigation, and remediation of security incidents.
	Conduct forensic analysis and root cause investigations of security breaches.


Risk Management & Compliance:


	Perform regular security risk assessments and vulnerability testing to identify potential threats.
	Ensure compliance with regulatory and industry security frameworks such as ISO 27001, NIST, PCI-DSS, and GDPR.
	Collaborate with audit teams to address security gaps and implement corrective actions.


Team Leadership & Collaboration:


	Lead, mentor, and develop a team of network security professionals, ensuring continuous skills enhancement.
	Work closely with IT, risk management, compliance, and business units to align security strategies with organizational objectives.
	Conduct training and awareness programs to educate employees on network security best practices.


Security Monitoring & Reporting:


	Oversee security monitoring tools and ensure proactive threat detection and response.
	Maintain and review security logs, reports, and dashboards to track incidents and vulnerabilities.
	Provide regular security updates and risk assessments to senior management and key stakeholders.


Project & Budget Management:


	Manage security projects, including implementation of new security solutions and infrastructure improvements.
	Develop and manage network security budgets, ensuring cost-effective security investments.
	Conduct vendor assessments and manage third-party security service providers.


Knowledge, Skills & Experience
Experience & Qualifications:


	A University Degree in Computer Science, IS, Computer Engineering or related. 
	12+ years of experience in Network Security and minimum 2 of which must have been spent in firewall management, Architecture, Design and Implementation. 
	Experience in Networks, Data Communication and Network Security. 
	Demonstrate experience at the CCIE level
	F5 Certified Administrator or Engineer
	Microsoft AZ-500 (Azure Security Technologies)
	 ITIL Certification
	Experience with network security practices, including VPN, DNS, HTTP/HTTPS, SSL/TLS, firewalls, Cloud native load balancers and web application firewalls (WAF).
	Expert level, hands-on experience in installing, upgrading, designing and configuring routers, firewalls, Application delivery solutions, Cisco, F5 in larger customer environments. 
	Experience of the following Solutions: Cisco routers and switches including IOS, NXOS, Cisco Firewalls, Juniper Firewalls, Palo Alto Firewalls, Wireshark, SolarWinds, AppDynamics, Dynatrace etc.). 
	Solid understanding of Network design principles such as Hierarchical, High Availability, Scalability, Secure etc. 
	Solid understanding of routed and switched architecture, network bandwidth and traffic prioritization and QoS concepts. 
	Solid Understanding of Network Security design and implementation, such as Firewalls, Access Control list, route filtering etc.
	Solid understanding and experience of designing and implementing QOS, PBR, Queuing and traffic engineering and prioritization techniques. 
	Solid understanding and application of the OSI model in troubleshooting, fault finding and problem resolution. 
	Have the experience and ability to translate business requirement document into High level design and ability to translate High level design into Low Level design or detailed design that is fit for implementation. 
	Understanding and experience of various Layer 2 LAN and WAN technologies such as Ethernet, EtherChannel, Port channel, LACP, Spanning Tree, VPC, OTV, MPLS.     
	Maintain clear documentation for network/application delivery configurations, processes, and troubleshooting procedures.
	Understanding and experience of various Layer 2 LAN and WAN technologies such as Ethernet, EtherChannel, Port channel, LACP, Spanning Tree, VPC, OTV, MPLS.
	Understand and have the experience of various Layer 3 LAN and WAN technologies such as IP Addressing, Summarization techniques, Routing Protocols such as Static, OSPF, BGP, route redistribution and route filtering. 
	Ability to manage multiple projects and manage customer and project manager expectations 
	Perform the installation and configuration of network equipment such as routers, switches, Firewalls and network application delivery solutions. 
	Research and evaluate new configurations and equipment with the management team; make recommendations to the team. 
	Assist with development of tools to ensure smooth functioning of IT Support 
	Basic understanding of Microsoft Windows servers, VMware and data replication. 
	Understanding of ITIL and Service Management SLAs.


Skills, Capabilities & Direct attributes:


	Leadership skills in leading people in different countries. 
	People and stakeholder management skills. 
	Time Management and quick turn-around times is highly essential. 
	Strong interpersonal skills in influencing and working in multiple countries with different culture, mind set and language. 
	Able to work on multiple tasks, dealing with multiple functions and manage multiple resources in a matrix organization. 


Application Closing Date: 30th January, 2026, 08:00 PM.

title: Job Vacancies at Latins Security Limited
content:
Latins Security Limited is a private security company, established by a team of highly skilled and dedicated security professionals to tackle and provide total security solutions for individuals as well as private and government organizations.As an independent company focused on providing quality security services, We pride ourselves on providing the highest quality security personnel and solutions that are tailored to our clients’ specific requirements.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.)  Admin / Human Resource Officer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The HR / Admin officer will oversee all human resource and administrative operations, ensuring effective workforce management, compliance with labor laws, and efficient office administration.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement HR policies, procedures, and systems
	Manage recruitment, selection, onboarding, and employee exits
	Oversee performance management, training, and staff development programs
	Handle employee relations, discipline, and grievance resolution
	Manage payroll coordination, leave administration, and staff welfare
	Oversee office administration, facilities, logistics, and vendor management
	Ensure compliance with Nigerian labor laws and company policies
	Maintain accurate employee records and HR reports


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor's Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field with a minimum of 4 years of HR / Admin experience
	Professional HR certification (CIPM, SHRM, etc.) is an advantage
	Strong knowledge of labor laws and HR best practices.


Key Competencies:


	HR strategy and policy implementation
	Organizational and people management
	Conflict resolution and communication
	Administrative and operational efficiency


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their Resume and cover letter to: latins@latinssecurity.ng using the Job Position and Location as subject of the mail.

 

2.) Patrol Supervisor

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a highly qualified and motivated Patrol Supervisor to join our esteemed security company.
	The ideal candidate should possess a blend of leadership skills, extensive knowledge of security protocols, and a commitment to upholding the highest standards of safety and security.
	As a Patrol Supervisor, you will be responsible for overseeing the daily operations of our security personnel, ensuring compliance with all security measures, and managing emergency situations with professionalism and efficiency.
	Proactive approach to problem-solving, excellent communication skills, and the ability to work collaboratively with various departments.
	Pivotal in providing guidance and support to security staff, conducting regular evaluations, and implementing training programs aimed at enhancing the effectiveness of our patrol operations.
	Contribute to the development of strategic security initiatives and retention of quality personnel, thereby ensuring a safe environment for all employees and clients.


Responsibilities


	Supervise and coordinate the activities of security personnel assigned to you.
	Conduct regular inspections of security personnel to ensure adherence to protocols and standards.
	Prepare and maintain detailed reports on security incidents, operational activities, and personnel performance.
	Develop and implement training programs for new and existing security personnel.
	Respond to emergency situations and provide direction to personnel during crises.
	Collaborate with management to create and refine security protocols and procedures.
	Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of patrol routes and security measures, making recommendations for improvements.


Requirements


	A high school diploma or equivalent.
	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications with 5 years of experience.
	Proven experience in security operations or law enforcement, with a minimum of 5 years in a supervisory role.
	Strong leadership and team management skills, with the ability to motivate and influence others.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills for effective reporting and interaction with staff.
	Ability to assess and respond to emergency situations promptly and effectively.
	Knowledge of security technology and equipment, including surveillance systems.
	Proven Integrity and discipline
	Proficiency in incident reporting and records management software.
	Ability to recruit, train and deploy security personnel.
	Ability to source potential clients for the company.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their Resume and cover letter to: latins@latinssecurity.ng using the Job Position and Location as subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Driver

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications.
	Knowledge of Abuja is a MUST.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: latins@latinssecurity.ng using the Job Position and location as subject of the mail.
